titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Postcards Documenting the German Occupation of East Africa
Postcards Documenting the German Occupation of East Africa
titlestmt.author: compiled by Mary Caldera

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 11:21

did.unittitle: Postcards documenting the German occupation of East Africa

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of forty-eight black and white postcards from the Belgian Propoganda Ministry following the invasion of German East Africa in 1917. Although German forces in German East Africa were never defeated, the postcards show 'Occupied' German East Africa.

langmaterial.language: Postcard captions are in German, French, and Dutch.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator, 2007.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Postcards Documenting the German Occupation of East Africa (MS 1899). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of forty-eight black and white postcards from the Belgian Propoganda Ministry following the invasion of German East Africa in 1917. Although German forces in German East Africa were never defeated, the postcards show 'Occupied' German East Africa.
